meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was bestrewing flower petals along the path.
meanings.sent2: The wind was bestrewing leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was bestrewing acorns in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush was bestrewing colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The children were bestrewing glitter on the classroom floor.

meanings.sent1: He was bestrewing the table with papers and books.
meanings.sent2: The party decorations were bestrewing the room with color.
meanings.sent3: The magician was bestrewing the stage with playing cards.
meanings.sent4: The snowstorm was bestrewing the landscape with white flakes.
meanings.sent5: The chef was bestrewing the dish with fresh herbs.
